Detailed Description

MySQL query handle.

To make the results from different databases compatible with the same set of generic methods all databases that return a database query return it in a class that fits to this protocol. This is for MySQL.

Author:
Elliot Chance

Definition at line 14 of file CMMySQLQuery.php.

Member Function Documentation

availableMethods (  ) 

Class methods this query supports. 

 $q = $dbh->query("select * from mytable");
 $features = $q->availableMethods();
 if(!in_array($features, 'next'))
   die("We can't read the result!");

Implements CMQueryProtocol.

Definition at line 66 of file CMMySQLQuery.php.

fetch ( $  rowMode = 'assoc',
$  formatter = false 
)

Return the next result row from the query as an associative array.

Once all the rows in the result set have been interated false is returned. 

 $q = $dbh->query("select * from mytable");
 while($r = $q->next()) {
  print_r($r);
 }
Parameters:
$rowMode How each row is converted into an array.

'assoc' Associative array. This is the default
'line' Non-associative array.
'pair' First and second column become key-value.
'cell' Only use the first column.
$formatter See Using a formatter on indervidual fetch() calls

Implements CMQueryProtocol.

Definition at line 105 of file CMMySQLQuery.php.

fetchAll ( $  rowMode = 'assoc',
$  direction = 'horizontal',
$  formatter = false 
)

Fetch all rows.

$direction

'horizontal' Each row is a new array. This is the default
'vertical' All the rows are appended in a single linear array.
'single' Only use the first row.
Parameters:
$rowMode How each row is converted into an array.
$direction The fetching direction.
$formatter See Using a formatter on indervidual fetch() calls
See also:
fetch()

Implements CMQueryProtocol.

totalRows (  ) 

Total number of rows in the result set.

If the query failed then 0 is returned.
